tacticulous.game.graphicalui

Class ActionController

  • java.lang.Object
    • tacticulous.game.graphicalui.ActionController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActionListener, EventListener

    public class ActionController
extends Object
implements ActionListener
    Main control and logic class for graphical user interface.
    Author:
    O
    See Also:
    MouseController

      Checks which commands are valid for the currently active player's currently selected unit and current target tile

    • Constructor Detail

      • ActionController

        public ActionController(Game game,
                JComponent mapDisplay,
                JTextArea activeUnitDisplay,
                JTextArea targetTileDisplay,
                JTextArea gameLog)
        constructs game command buttons
        Parameters:
        game - access to game data
        mapDisplay - access to map display
        activeUnitDisplay - displays current unit's description
        targetTileDisplay - displays current target tile's and unit's description
        gameLog - displays game events.

        private void checkActiveUnitIndex()
        Resets active unit index to 0 if necessary.

      • activeUnit

        public Unit activeUnit()
        Returns currently selected unit.
        Returns:
        null if no units with actions remain.

        public void checkLegitActions()
        Checks which commands are valid for the currently active player's currently selected unit and current target tile

        Updates the units with actions list to match the cruel reality.

        Updates active unit and target tile displays.

      • updateLogDisplay

        public void updateLogDisplay()
        Updates game log display, printing new events.

      • disableAll

        public void disableAll()
        Disables all controls.

      • playerCommands

        public void playerCommands()
        Toggles human (or equivalent) controls on and AI controls off.

      • aiCommands

        public void aiCommands()
        Toggles human (or equivalent) controls off and AI controls on.

      • canAttack

        public boolean canAttack()
        Used by the MouseController.
        Returns:
        true if attack button is enabled.

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove()
        Used by the MouseController.
        Returns:
        true if move button is enabled.

      • checkWhichControls

        private void checkWhichControls()
        Checks if current player is AI-controlled or not and chooses controls accordingly.

      • checkIfUnitCyclingEnabled

        private void checkIfUnitCyclingEnabled()
        Checks if current unit is in the middle of an action or the only unit with actions remaining this round and if so, disables the next/previous unit buttons.

      • checkIfMoveEnabled

        private void checkIfMoveEnabled()
        Checks if active unit has move action remaining and if target square is withing movement range. Otherwise move button is disabled.

      • checkIfAttackEnabled

        private void checkIfAttackEnabled()
        Checks if active unit has attack action remaining and if target square is withing attack range and contains another unit. Otherwise attack button is disabled.

      • checkIfDelayEnabled

        private void checkIfDelayEnabled()
        Checks if active unit has delay action remaining. Otherwise attack button is disabled.

      • notTargetingSelf

        private boolean notTargetingSelf()
        Checks if targeted tile is the same as active unit's tile.
        Returns:
        true if not same or targetTile is null.
